intro: Pavetta murleensis var. glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth pavetta, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a smooth texture, giving it the varietal name "glabrescens." It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories.
